p: The sterilized quartz sand and roseite were mixed in proportion of 2:1 as P. notoginseng culture medium. The petroleum ether extract was mixed into the matrix, and the concentrations were 0.25 mg/g and 0.5 mg/g. The healthy P. notoginseng seedlings were submerged in a mixed conidial suspension containing 1 × 10 6 cfu /mL of both F. oxysporum and F. solani for 2 h. Six P. notoginseng plants were planted into a pot. The culture medium without petroleum ether extract was set as a negative control. Three replicates was performed. After 20 days of infection by the pathogenic fungi, the plants were graded for severity of wilt disease as 0 (not showing chlorosis), 1 (the stem soft), 2 (the stem fallen, but the leaf not wilted), and 3 (plant wilting). The wilting rate (%) = the number of wilting plants/total number of plants × 100. Disease index = ∑(rating × number of plants rated)/(total number of plants × highest rating) × 100 [ 20].
